planet.name: Kepler-105 b
KOI-115 b
KOI-115.01
KIC 9579641 b
KIC 9579641.01
planet.description: Kepler-105 b has been discovered by the Kepler spacecraft and was originally classified as a planet candidate. A new statistical analysis led by a team at NASA Ames Research Center has validated the planet with more than 99 percent confidence. Although many parameters of Kepler-105 b are still unknown, the object is highly unlikely to be a false positive.

planet.name: Kepler-105 c
KOI-115 c
KOI-115.02
KIC 9579641 c
KIC 9579641.02
planet.description: Kepler-105 c has been discovered by the Kepler spacecraft and was originally classified as a planet candidate. A new statistical analysis led by a team at NASA Ames Research Center has validated the planet with more than 99 percent confidence. Although many parameters of Kepler-105 c are still unknown, the object is highly unlikely to be a false positive. TTV measurements indicate it is likely to be rocky.

planet.name: KOI-115.03
planet.description: KOI-115.03 is an unconfirmed transiting planet orbiting Kepler-105.
